bioghist.p: Frederick Williamson Beasley, Jr. (1845-1871), received his Bachelor's degree from the University of Pennsylvania in 1866 and an honorary Doctor of Divinity degree in 1868. He was rector of All Saints Church in Lower Dublin, Pennsylvania. His father, Frederick Beasley (1777-1845), was ordained a deacon in the Episcopal Church in 1801 and a priest the following year. After serving as rector of several congregations in New Jersey, New York, and Maryland, Beasley accepted a position at the University of Pennsylvania as Professor of Moral Philosophy and Provost of the University, where he remained until 1928. He received an honorary Doctor of Divinity degree from the University in 1815.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of papers of Rev. Frederick W. Beasley and Rev. Frederick W. Beasley, Jr. Materials related to Beasley, Sr. include a certificate of priesthood, 1802, and letters from Beasley to his wife and son. Frederick Beasley, Jr. materials include a deed for cemetery lots; correspondence from the University of Pennsylvania regarding his honorary Doctor of Divinity degree; and a certificate of membership to the Evangelical Education Society. The collection also includes a letter from Mary Rowe Beasley seeking information about Frederick Beasley, 1929.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
